body: I think that's because you don't have a `main.js` file.

@dougnukem @BinaryMuse This is definitely a bug that should be fixed, can you rename the app's name back to `app` and print the result of `require.resolve('app')`, `module.paths` and `__dirname` in your `main.js`?

@zcbenz With it named `app`:

```
require.resolve('app') /Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/app/main.js
module.paths [ '/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/app/node_modules',
  '/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/node_modules',
  '/Users/btilley/minerva/node_modules',
  '/Users/btilley/node_modules',
  '/Users/node_modules',
  '/node_modules' ]
__dirname /Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/app
```

With it named `webapp`:

```
require.resolve('app') /Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/app.js
module.paths [ '/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/webapp/node_modules',
  '/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/node_modules',
  '/Users/btilley/minerva/node_modules',
  '/Users/btilley/node_modules',
  '/Users/node_modules',
  '/node_modules' ]
__dirname /Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/webapp
```

It seems like it has to do with the working directory from where the atom-shell is launched from.

if I rename it the folder to `app` and then run it from the project's root directory:

```
[@ddaniels-mbp:~/code/.../atom-apps/hello-atom (master)]$ ./build/atom-shell/Atom.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom app/
process.cwd() =/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom
require.resolve('app') =  /Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/app/main.js
module.paths =  [ '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/app/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/node_modules',
  '/Users/node_modules',
  '/node_modules' ]
__dirname =  /Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/app
```

But if I run the atom-shell from one directory above then it's fine (it seems like require.resolve() is using the current working directory as the first place to resolve the require('app'))

```
[@ddaniels-mbp:~/code/.../atom-apps]$ ./hello-atom/build/atom-shell/Atom.app/Contents/MacOS/Atom ./hello-atom/app/
process.cwd() =/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps
require.resolve('app') =  /Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/build/atom-shell/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib/app.js
module.paths =  [ '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/app/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/github/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/code/node_modules',
  '/Users/ddaniels/node_modules',
  '/Users/node_modules',
  '/node_modules' ]
__dirname =  /Users/ddaniels/code/github/atom-apps/hello-atom/app
[27667:0507/214422:INFO:renderer_main.cc(227)] Renderer process started
```

It seems like the LOAD_AS_DIRECTORY(X) is getting called in the require.resolve() logic (http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.11.13/api/all.html#all_all_together), although it makes it seem like that only gets called if it's being required in as a relative path`./`, `../` or in LOAD_NODE_MODULES somehow it's using the current working directory?

```
require(X) from module at path Y
1. If X is a core module,
   a. return the core module
   b. STOP
2. If X begins with './' or '/' or '../'
   a. LOAD_AS_FILE(Y + X)
   b. LOAD_AS_DIRECTORY(Y + X)
3. LOAD_NODE_MODULES(X, dirname(Y))
4. THROW "not found"

LOAD_AS_FILE(X)
1. If X is a file, load X as JavaScript text.  STOP
2. If X.js is a file, load X.js as JavaScript text.  STOP
3. If X.node is a file, load X.node as binary addon.  STOP

LOAD_AS_DIRECTORY(X)
1. If X/package.json is a file,
   a. Parse X/package.json, and look for "main" field.
   b. let M = X + (json main field)
   c. LOAD_AS_FILE(M)
2. If X/index.js is a file, load X/index.js as JavaScript text.  STOP
3. If X/index.node is a file, load X/index.node as binary addon.  STOP

LOAD_NODE_MODULES(X, START)
1. let DIRS=NODE_MODULES_PATHS(START)
2. for each DIR in DIRS:
   a. LOAD_AS_FILE(DIR/X)
   b. LOAD_AS_DIRECTORY(DIR/X)

NODE_MODULES_PATHS(START)
1. let PARTS = path split(START)
2. let ROOT = index of first instance of "node_modules" in PARTS, or 0
3. let I = count of PARTS - 1
4. let DIRS = []
5. while I > ROOT,
   a. if PARTS[I] = "node_modules" CONTINUE
   c. DIR = path join(PARTS[0 .. I] + "node_modules")
   b. DIRS = DIRS + DIR
   c. let I = I - 1
6. return DIRS
```

The strangest thing is I could not reproduce this issue. Can you do `export NODE_DEBUG=module` in the shell before running the app? It would make atom-shell print out how the module was searched.

Also please check if you have `NODE_PATH` environment variable set.

There is one instance of `looking for "app"` that happens from somewhere else (with formatting applied):

```
MODULE 74150: Module._load REQUEST  app parent: .
MODULE 74150: looking for "app" in [
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/lib/node_modules",

  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/api/lib"

```

and if I include `require("app")` or `require.resolve("app")` in the script, it additionally shows:

```
MODULE 74202: looking for "app" in [
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/app/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/node_modules",

  "",

  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/api/lib"
]
```

```
$ echo $NODE_PATH
/Users/btilley/.nvm/v0.11.2/lib/node_modules:
```

After unsetting `NODE_PATH`, the app works fine. Here is the output from setting `NODE_DEBUG`:

```
MODULE 74729: Module._load REQUEST  app parent: .
MODULE 74729: looking for "app" in [
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/lib/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/node_modules",
  "/Users/node_modules",
  "/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/.node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/.node_libraries",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/lib/node",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/api/lib"
]

...

MODULE 74729: Module._load REQUEST  app parent: /Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/default_app/main.js
MODULE 74729: looking for "app" in [
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/default_app/node_modules",
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/node_modules"
  "/Users/node_modules"
  "/node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/.node_modules"
  "/Users/btilley/.node_libraries"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/lib/node"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/browser/api/lib"
  "/Users/btilley/minerva/picasso-native/Picasso.app/Contents/Resources/atom/common/api/lib"
]
```
The problem is the trailing `:` in `NODE_PATH`: `/Users/btilley/.nvm/v0.11.2/lib/node_modules:`, it would append `""` to the search paths of `require`, which then was treated as current directory.
@zcbenz Yep, and it appears to be an issue with nvm.
This bug was submitted to nvm: https://github.com/creationix/nvm/issues/414.

Thanks for the `nvm` bug!

Please note, though: `nvm` should be installed from the latest tagged release, and _not_ from latest master.
